intro: Piper szemaoense, commonly known as the Semaos mountain pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, dark-colored berry that is used in traditional medicine and as a spice in local cuisines.
